column2: ENGLISH
A Tribute of Gold?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy to offer the Dragon Throne a tribute of gold, should you wish to accept it.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I sure love gold!
Gold is nice, I guess...
I suppose I should accept it...
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your gift, and wishes to let you know that gold is a particularly welcome gift.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your gift. Gold is neither particularly welcome nor particularly unwelcome.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your gift, but wishes to let you know that gold is not particularly needed at the moment
Perhaps I should send more gold...?
As would be expected
I suppose other tributes might be better...

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] refuses your paltry gift and has no interest in associating with people such as you.
I shall remember this insult!
A New Tributary?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy to offer [FromFrom.GetHerHis] submission to the Dragon Throne as a tributary, should you wish to accept it.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
Of course the [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] should be my tributary!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your request to become a tributary.
As would be expected!
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has deemed you unworthy of becoming a tributary.
I shall remember this insult!
A Tribute of Horses?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy with an offer to supply the Dragon Throne with horses, should you wish to accept it.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
The armies of the Middle Kingdom could always use more horses!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your offer to supply horses.
A profitable agreement!
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has no interest in having horses supplied by you.
I shall remember this insult!
No More Horses
[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy to inform you that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] will no longer be supplying the Middle Kingdom with horses.
I shall remember this insult!
The Dragon Throne will remember that you broke your agreement to supply horses. You might find it harder to receive Boons in the future.
I suppose I can see why [From.GetBestName] is upset...
A Eunuch for China?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy bringing with him a eunuch, [FromFromFrom.GetFullName], as a tribute, should you wish to accept him.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I could use another eunuch!
My vassal could use a eunuch!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts the eunuch you sent, and will keep him at court.
I hope they find a use for him!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts the eunuch you sent, but [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to give him to a vassal instead of keeping him at court.
That is not what I had in mind...
The Dragon Throne has no need for your eunuch.
[FromFromFromFrom.GetFirstName] will probably be a bit upset...
A Concubine for China?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy bringing with him [FromFromFrom.GetFullName], who is being offered as a concubine, should you wish to accept her.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I could always use another concubine!
My heir could always use another concubine!
My vassal could always use a concubine!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your concubine, and wishes to inform you that she will be the Emperor's personal concubine.
Just as planned.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your concubine, and wishes to inform you that she will be given to the heir to the Dragon Throne.
That's fair enough.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your concubine, but she is not worthy of being an imperial consort and will be given to a vassal.
That's not what I wanted!
The Dragon Throne has no intention to accept a concubine from you.
How dare [From.GetBestName]?
A New Commander?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy bringing with him [FromFromFrom.GetFullName], offering [FromFromFrom.GetHerHim] as a commander, should you wish to accept them.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I could use another commander!
My vassal could use another commander!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your commander, and will keep [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHim] at court.
As I expected!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your commander, but will give [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHim] to a vassal.
Not what I wanted to hear...
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has no interest in accepting a commander from you.
Fine! I will keep my commander!
A New Physician?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] name has sent an envoy bringing with him [FromFromFrom.GetFullName], offering [FromFromFrom.GetHerHim] as a physician, should you wish to accept them.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I could use a new physician!
My vassal could use a new physician!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your physician, and will keep [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHim] at court.
As I expected!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your physician, but will give [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHim] to a vassal.
Not what I wanted to hear...
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has no interest in accepting a physician from you.
Fine! I will keep my physician!
Relief for China?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy bringing with him an offer to send relief to alleviate the current strain on the population of the Middle Kingdom, should you wish to accept it.\n\nAccepting the relief would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
We could certainly use the relief!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your offer of relief. All help in this time of need is appreciated.
As would be expected!
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has no interest in any relief you are prepared to offer.
I shall remember this insult!
A New Artifact?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has send an envoy bringing with him [FromFromFrom.GetBaseName] and offers it as a gift to the Dragon Throne, should you wish to accept it.\n\nAccepting the tribute would give [FromFrom.GetTitledName] some Grace, which [FromFrom.GetSheHe] might use to request a Boon in the future, but refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I will accept the artifact!
I will give the artifact to my vassal!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts the artifact you sent, and it will be added to the imperial treasury.
As I expected!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to accept your artifact, but it will be given to a vassal.
That's not quite what I wanted...
The Dragon Throne has no interest in your baubles.
Then I shall put it to better use!
Peace for our time?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for an official Peace Deal between the [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
Of course we will sign such a treaty!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] is in agreement. A Peace Deal has been signed between the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], lasting for fifty years or until the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] no longer sits on the Dragon Throne.
Great news!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has no intention of agreeing to a Peace Deal with barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Send a Physician?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking you for a physician as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
A physician will be sent!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has dispatched [chinese_doctor.GetBestName] to serve as your Court Physician.
[chinese_doctor.GetSheHeCap] will serve me well!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] will not waste the talents of the Middle Kingdom's physicians on barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Send an Artifact?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for a Chinese artifact as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
I will send a plain artifact!
I will send a good artifact!
I will send the finest artifact possible!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason
How plain do you wish for the artifact to be sent to [FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] to be?
The simplest possible artifact will do.
A bit less plain than the bare minimum.
Which artifact do you wish to send to [FromFromFromFrom.GetTitledName]?
A Painting of Shanguang Tí!
A Small Figurine!
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a Painting of Shanguang Tí.
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a Small Figurine.
That's not as majestic as I had hoped...
Which artifact do you wish to send to [FromFromFromFrom.GetTitledName]?
A [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Arm Protector!
A Serpent Spear!
A Tapestry Depicting Trade!
Something else
A [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Artwork!
Some [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Calligraphy!
A [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Sculpture!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Arm Protector.
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a Serpent Spear.
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a Tapestry Depicting Trade.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Artwork.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you some [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Calligraphy.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Sculpture.
Plain, but sensible, I guess...
How grand do you wish for the artifact to be sent to [FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] to be?
Neither grand nor plain
A bit on the grand side
Which artifact do you wish to send to [FromFromFromFrom.GetTitledName]?
A Silk Shroud!
A [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Tapestry!
A Ji!
Something else
A Zhuge Crossbow!
A [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Bronze Sculpture!
Some Ceremonial Robes!
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a Silk Shroud.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Tapestry.
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a Ji.
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a Zhuge Crossbow.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Bronze Sculpture.
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you some Ceremonial Robes.
That's quite nice!
Which artifact do you wish to send to [FromFromFromFrom.GetTitledName]?
A Water Clock!
A Jian!
A Dragon Amulet!
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a Water Clock.
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a Jian.
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a Dragon Amulet.
The [From.GetTitle] of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is generous indeed!
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a Jade Dragon.
This is indeed a grand gift!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] will not give any artifact from the Middle Kingdom to barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Send a Siege Engineer?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for a siege engineer as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
A siege engineer will be sent!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has dispatched [chinese_siege_engineer.GetBestName] to serve you as a siege engineer.
[chinese_siege_engineer.GetSheHeCap] will serve me well!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] will not waste the talents of the Middle Kingdom's siege engineers on barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Send a Strategist?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for a strategist as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
A strategist will be sent!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has dispatched [chinese_strategist.GetBestName] to serve you as a strategist.
[chinese_strategist.GetSheHeCap] will serve me well!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] will not waste the talents of the Middle Kingdom's strategists on barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Send a Scholar-Bureaucrat?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for a scholar-bureaucrat as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
A scholar-bureaucrat will be sent!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has dispatched [chinese_administrator.GetBestName] to serve you as a scholar-bureaucrat.
[chinese_administrator.GetSheHeCap] will serve me well!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] will not waste the talents of the Middle Kingdom's scholar-bureaucrats on barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Send a Master Engineer?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for a master engineer as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
A master engineer will be sent!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has dispatched [chinese_master_engineer.GetBestName] to serve you as a master engineer.
[chinese_master_engineer.GetSheHeCap] will serve me well!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] will not waste the talents of the Middle Kingdom's master engineers on barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
Sign a Trade Contract?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for a Chinese Trade Contract as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
Of course we will grant them this Boon!
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, without a reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] is in agreement. A Trade Contract has been signed between the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], lasting for twenty-five years or until the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty no longer sits on the Dragon Throne.
This will surely be a profitable agreement!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has no intention of agreeing to a Trade Contract with barbarians like [Root.GetTitledName].
I will not forget this!
An Imperial Marriage?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for an Imperial Marriage between [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] and a Chinese princess of your choice as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
[dragon_bride_1.GetBestName] shall marry [FromFromFrom.GetBestName]!
[dragon_bride_2.GetBestName] will be sent!
[dragon_bride_3.GetBestName] is the perfect bride!
Unfortunately, I have no princess to send...
[FromFromFrom.GetBestName] does not deserve an Imperial Marriage!
The Dragon Throne refuses, because I said so!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].

The [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to an Imperial Marriage between [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName] and [dragon_bride.GetFullName].

In addition to sending the bride-to-be, [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to a Peace Deal between the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], lasting for fifty years or until the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty no longer sits on the Dragon Throne.
May the union be fruitful!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] is unfortunately unable to send an Imperial Princess to marry [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName] at this time. [From.GetBestName] has, however, agreed to refund the Grace the request cost you, and will of course consider future Boon requests from you.
I suppose we could try again later...

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] will not send an Imperial Princess to marry a barbarian like [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName], as he is unworthy of such an honor.
I will not forget this!
A New Concubine

[FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a new concubine, [From.GetBestName], who was sent to become an imperial concubine by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] but was deemed unworthy of the imperial court.
I suppose I could use another concubine...
A New Eunuch

[FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a new eunuch, [From.GetBestName], who was sent to become an imperial eunuch by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] but was deemed unworthy of the imperial court.
I suppose I could use another eunuch...
A New Commander

[FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a new commander, [From.GetBestName], who was sent to become an imperial commander by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] but was deemed unworthy of the imperial court.
I suppose I could use another commander
A New Physician

[FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a new physician, [From.GetBestName], who was sent to become an imperial physician by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] but was deemed unworthy of the imperial court.
I suppose I could use a physician...
A New Artifact

[From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you an artifact, [tribute_artifact.GetBaseName], which was sent as a tribute by [FromFrom.GetTitledName] but was deemed unworthy of becoming part of the imperial collection.
I suppose I can find a use for it...

Your current Grace is [Root.grace.GetValue].

Grace is gained when pleasing the Dragon Throne, and lost if you displease the Dragon Throne, and can be spent to request Boons from the Dragon Throne, and any unspent Grace will be inherited by your primary heir.

However, should the current dynasty lose the Dragon Throne, all Grace is lost.
Good to know!
Chinese Princess (unmarried)
This woman is a member of the extended Chinese Imperial Family and cannot marry normally.
Chinese Princess (married)
This woman is a member of the extended Chinese Imperial Family.
Chinese Tribute
This character has been sent to China as a Tribute and has therefore been barred from inheriting any titles.
Sent gold as tribute
Refused gold as tribute
Became my tributary
Refused to become suzerain
Breakaway tributary
Agreed to supply horses as tribute
Refused horses as tribute
Broke agreement to supply horses
Sent eunuch as tribute
Sent low-quality eunuch as tribute
Did not keep eunuch
Refused eunuch as tribute
Sent concubine as tribute
Sent low-quality concubine as tribute
Did not keep concubine
Refused concubine as tribute
Sent commander as tribute
Sent low-quality commander as tribute
Did not keep commander
Refused commander as tribute
Sent physician as tribute
Sent low-quality physician as tribute
Did not keep physician
Refused physician as tribute
Sent relief as tribute
Refused relief as tribute
Sent artifact as tribute
Sent low quality artifact as tribute
Did not keep artifact
Refused artifact as tribute
Did not grant Peace Deal
Did not grant physician
Did not grant artifact
Did not grant siege engineer
Did not grant strategist
Did not grant Scholar-Bureaucrat
Did not grant master engineer
Did not grant Trade Contract
Unable to grant Imperial Marriage
Did not grant Imperial Marriage
Given concubine
Given eunuch
Given commander
Given physician
Given artifact
Empire of China

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].

The [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] no longer considers the Peace Deal between our realms to be in its interest. Surely you cannot fault our reasoning.

Signed,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
[FromFrom.GetSheHeCap] dares break our agreement?

[Root.GetTitledName],

I thought the Dragon Throne could be trusted, but it is evident that the Middle Kingdom is ruled by a liar and a thief. I will remember this betrayal of trust.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Oh, well...

[Root.GetTitledName],

Our Peace Deal is no longer in my interest. Surely you will understand that I end it prematurely.
Signed,

[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
The Dragon Throne will remember this!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].

The [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName]'s memory is long, and barbarians who turn their backs on its mercy will be taught the price of their folly when the time is right.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
I hope it was worth it...
An Imperial Marriage?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for an Imperial Marriage between [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] and [From.GetBestName] as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has earned enough Grace to request this Boon.\n\nRefusing the Boon without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
Of course we will agree to this!
I have other plans for her...
[FromFromFrom.GetBestName] does not deserve an Imperial Marriage!
The Dragon Throne refuses, because I said so!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].

The [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to an Imperial Marriage between [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName] and [dragon_bride.GetFullName].

In addition to sending the bride-to-be, [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to a Peace Deal between the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], lasting for fifty years or until the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty no longer sits on the Dragon Throne.
May the union be fruitful!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] is unfortunately unable to agree to the marriage you asked for on behalf of [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName] at this time. [From.GetBestName] has, however, agreed to refund the Grace the request cost you, and will of course consider future Boon requests from you.
I suppose we could try again later...

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] will not send an Imperial Princess to marry a barbarian like [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName], as he is unworthy of such an honor.
I will not forget this!

The Dragon Throne dislikes you, for one reason or another, and is unlikely to grant you Boons or to accept Tributes from you. Perhaps this will pass over time, or perhaps their dislike knows no bounds.
The Dragon Throne seems to have a neutral, or even positive, opinion of you, but keep in mind that if they desire your land some Boons and Tributes might be unavailable.
Let's not anger them further...
Sounds good!
A Guest for Dinner?

Word has reached you that [From.GetTitledName] is currently travelling through [Root.Capital.GetName]. Supposedly, [From.GetSheHe] is on [From.GetHerHis] way to China to kowtow before the Dragon Throne. Without doubt, [From.GetSheHe] would enjoy your hospitality, should you wish to extend it.
Ask them to come!
Ask them to come... to their death!
Let's not invite them!

As dinner is brought to the table, your servants bring out a goblet filled with the 'special' wine you asked them to fetch for [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and place it in front of them. [FromFrom.GetTitledName] drinks deeply, and the meal progresses for a while without incident. However, just as you start to suspect that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] must have taken an antidote, they suddenly start coughing and clearly have trouble breathing.\n'You will not get away with this!' they manage to say before expiring.\nSmiling, you wave a servant over to your side as the body of [FromFrom.GetTitledName] is being dragged away.

As dinner is brought to the table, your servants bring out a goblet filled with the 'special' wine you asked them to fetch for [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and place it in front of them. [FromFrom.GetTitledName] drinks deeply, then lets out a sigh.\n'You know, in the [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName], wine tastes a bit differently than this, most of the time,' they say, meeting your eyes and smiling ever so slightly. 'We also tend to see it as a breach of hospitality if a host tries to poison their guests.'\nEvidently, [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has taken an antidote to the poison you used beforehand, and as they reach for their sword you realize that things might be getting out of hand very rapidly.

As dinner is brought to the table, your servants bring out a goblet filled with the 'special' wine you asked them to fetch for [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and place it in front of them. However, to your surprise, [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has brought some wine of their own and seems perfectly content to drink from it instead of the poisoned goblet in front of them.\n'I hope you do not mind,' they say, drinking deeply, 'but I have always preferred the wine from home.'\nYou cannot tell if they suspect that you attempted to poison them or if they just got lucky, but it would seem that the plan is doomed to failure.
I think I will celebrate... with beer!
Guards! To me!
Are you sure you don't want to try my wine?
A Local Vintage

As evening arrives, [From.GetTitledName]'s servants have prepared a magnificient meal for you and [From.GetTitledName] to share.\nAs you previously have noticed that the wine you have found in foreign lands is surprisingly good, you gracefully accept [From.GetTitledName]'s offer of a goblet of what supposedly is 'the finest wine in all the world'. As you take the first sip, you notice a strance, almost unnoticeable taste of something unknown. You put it out of your mind and keep drinking, and the meal progresses.\nHowever, by the time the dinner is nearing its end, you start to cough, and as you look over at [From.GetTitledName] you can see them smiling.

As evening arrives, [From.GetTitledName]'s servants have prepared a magnificient meal for you and [From.GetTitledName] to share.\nAs you previously have noticed that the wine you have found in foreign lands is surprisingly good, you gracefully accept [From.GetTitledName]'s offer of a goblet of what supposedly is 'the finest wine in all the world'. As you take the first sip, you notice the slight, but unmistakable, taste of poison. Safe in the knowledge that you took an antidote before the meal, you drink deeply and consider your options.\nYou could try to kill [From.GetTitledName], even though their guards probably will aid them, or you could try to run away.

As evening arrives, [From.GetTitledName]'s servants have prepared a magnificient meal for you and [From.GetTitledName] to share.\nAs you previously have noticed that the wine you have found in foreign lands is less to your liking than that from home, you gracefully decline [From.GetTitledName]'s offer of a goblet of what supposedly is 'the finest wine in all the world'. For some reason, this seems to be making [From.GetTitledName] somewhat more unhappy than would be expected, but aside from repeatedly asking you if you want to try the wine nothing comes from your refusal.
Poison! No!
Time to kill!
Time to run!
I don't need it, thank you!

Just before dinner is about to begin, [FromFrom.GetTitledName] excuses themselves to head to the privy. You patiently await their return, but eventually it seems clear that they are going to be missing for a while, so you and the others present start eating.\nThe meal tastes differently from what you would expect. At first, you think that the servants have been trying something new with the spices. Then, as you start feeling unwell, you wonder if perhaps the ingredients have spoiled. However, none of the others present seem to be noticing anything unusual.\nAs pain erupts in your stomach and [FromFrom.GetTitledName] still is nowhere to be seen, you realize that you have been poisoned.

As your servants arrive with dinner, [FromFrom.GetTitledName] rises from the table in a hurry, almost knocking over their goblet. 'I need to visit the privy,' they hurriedly explain, rushing towards the doors.\nAs you are quite hungry already, you start your meal, but as soon as you swallow it you feel pain rapidly spreading throughout your entire body. Looking over towards [FromFrom.GetTitledName], you see them trying to push past the captain of your bodyguard, and you suddenly understand that you have been poisoned.\nBefore everything goes black, you have the satisfaction of seeing [FromFrom.GetTitledName] get cut down by your bodyguards, along with the servants and guards they had brought with them.

Shortly before dinner is about to begin, the commander of your bodyguard requests a meeting in private. As you trust him fully, you grant the request, and his men drag in a corpse dressed in the livery of the [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName].\n'We caught this man trying to poison your meal, my [Root.GetLordLady],' one of your bodyguards tell you when you inquire about the corpse. 'It seems clear that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] intended to betray your hospitality. What are your orders?'
Not like this!
At least they did not survive either!
Wipe them out! All of them!
A New Friend

You and [From.GetTitledName] quickly discover that you have a lot in common, and you stay up long into the night conversing on a variety of topics. By the time they depart, it is clear that this is a friendship that will last for some time.
Friends forever!
An Uneventful Evening

The meal you and [From.GetTitledName] share is better than the company, you soon realize, and though you do what you can to be a gracious host you almost feel like letting out a sigh in relief as [From.GetTitledName]'s party departs the next morning.
Well, that's that...
A Shadow in the Night

[From.GetTitledName] suddenly turns around and cuts down one of your guards, sprinting away from the table as their guards and servants quickly arm themselves to fight your remaining guards as they close in. You shout for your men to make sure [From.GetTitledName] cannot reach their horse, but in the confusion it is not clear if you are heard.\nAs the fighting dies down, several of your guards and servants are dead, as well as the guards and servants left behind by [From.GetTitledName], and you are informed by your remaining guards that [From.GetTitledName] and a small party have managed to escape. Even worse, they set your horses loose as well, and it is clear that any pursuit is doomed to failure.
Damn!
A Shadow in the Night

You quickly spin around and cut down one of the guards before [FromFrom.GetTitledName] can react, running from the table as you hear the guards and servants you left behind draw their weapons to fight [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards.\nIn the confusion, you manage to avoid [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards without any danger and make your way to your horse alongside a small party of your guards and servants that also have escaped from the fighting. With no time to waste, you ride off, having your guards set [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s horses free as you escape in the hopes of slowing down any pursuit.

You quickly spin around and cut down one of the guards before [FromFrom.GetTitledName] can react, running from the table as you hear the guards and servants you left behind draw their weapons to fight [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards.\nIn the confusion, you manage to fight your way past [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards, wounded but alive, and make your way to your horse alongside a small party of your guards and servants that also have escaped from the fighting. With no time to waste, you ride off, having your guards set [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s horses free as you escape in the hopes of slowing down any pursuit.
At least I got away unharmed!
This could have gone better...
An Arrow in the Night

[From.GetTitledName] suddenly turns around and cuts down one of your guards, sprinting away from the table as their guards and servants quickly arm themselves to fight your remaining guards as they close in. You shout for your men to make sure [From.GetTitledName] cannot reach their horse, but in the confusion it is not clear if you are heard.\nAs the fighting dies down, several of your guards and servants are dead, as well as the guards and servants left behind by [From.GetTitledName], but some of your remaining guards bring in [From.GetTitledName]'s corpse with an arrow sticking out of it. Despite things not going quite as planned, it would seem you have successfully killed [From.GetTitledName].
That went well, in the end!
An Arrow in the Night

You quickly spin around and cut down one of the guards before [FromFrom.GetTitledName] can react, running from the table as you hear the guards and servants you left behind draw their weapons to fight [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards.\nIn the confusion, you manage to avoid [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards without any danger and hurriedly move towards your horse longside a small party of your guards and servants that also have escaped from the fighting. Just as you are about to mount up, an arrow comes flying out of the dark, striking you in the chest, and the last thing you see before everything goes dark is more arrows striking the rest of your party.
No! I was so close...
Trechery's Reward

You expect [From.GetTitledName] to try to cut their way to their horse, but it becomes clear that that is not what they have in mind as they move towards you. You quickly pull free your own sword and call out for your guards as [From.GetTitledName]'s guards and servants also rise to their feet with weapons drawn.\nEven though you should have the advantage due to sheer numbers, the fight turns against you, and [From.GetTitledName] manages to disarm you. Before you can get another weapon into your hand, they thrust their sword into your throat, and your vision starts to fade even before they turn around to escape.
Not like this!
Trechery's Reward

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] clearly was expecting you to try to run away, as they almost don't have the time to pull free their sword before you are upon them. As your blades meet, you are vaguely aware that your guards and servants are doing what they can to fight off [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards that have arrived.\n[FromFrom.GetTitledName] should have the advantage due to the sheer number of guards they have nearby, but the fight still turns in your favor, and you disarm [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and quickly strike them down before they can grab another weapon. Taking in the situation around you, it is clear that you will be able to escape.
Thus is trechery rewarded!
An Uneven Fight

You expect [From.GetTitledName] to try to cut their way to their horse, but it becomes clear that that is not what they have in mind as they move towards you. You quickly pull free your own sword and call out for your guards as [From.GetTitledName]'s guards and servants also rise to their feet with weapons drawn.\nYou have the advantage due to sheer numbers, and the fight turns against [From.GetTitledName] and their guards. You disarm them before long, and before they can react you thrust your sword into their throat as your guards continue to cut down the rest of [From.GetTitledName]'s party.
Make sure they are truly dead!
An Uneven Fight

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] clearly was expecting you to try to run away, as they almost don't have the time to pull free their sword before you are upon them. As your blades meet, you are vaguely aware that your guards and servants are doing what they can to fight off [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards that have arrived.\n[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has the advantage due to the sheer number of guards they have nearby, and the fight quickly turns against you and your beleagued party. Before long, you are disarmed, and [FromFrom.GetTitledName], and they quickly strikes you down before you can grab another weapon.
Not like this!

The rider you sent to invite [From.GetTitledName] returns before long, informing you that [From.GetTitledName] and their party will not be joining you for dinner as they wish to travel quickly to reach their destination as soon as possible.
That's unfortunate
A Visitor from Afar

[From.GetTitledName] has arrived at your court, supposedly to kowtow before the Dragon Throne. As you do not like them, meeting them in person is obviously out of the question, and perhaps this is an opportunity for retribution...

[From.GetTitledName] has arrived at your court, supposedly to kowtow before the Dragon Throne. However, even for a barbarian they have been unusually disruptive at court, and perhaps they should not be allowed into your presence.

[From.GetTitledName] has arrived at your court, supposedly to kowtow before the Dragon Throne. While they are not fitting in as well as some might like, they are not being as disruptive as some barbarians have been in the past.

[From.GetTitledName] has arrived at your court, supposedly to kowtow before the Dragon Throne. Even though they are a barbarian, they are behaving almost as well as if they have been raised in the Middle Kingdom, and your ministers are most impressed.
Let them kowtow before a depiction of me!
They can kowtow before me, but quickly!
They can kowtow before me, as I am impressed!
Have them escorted to the dungeon!
The Dragon's Wrath

As you wait for the ministers at [From.GetTitledName]'s court to arrange for you to kowtow before the Dragon Throne, a number of guards come rushing in and surround your party. Before long, you are all escorted down to the dungeons to await your fate.
Oh no!
[From.GetTitledName] has agreed to your request to turn over [From.escaped_chinese_noble.GetName], and they have been imprisoned to await punushment.
Good!
[From.GetTitledName] has refused your request to turn over [From.escaped_chinese_noble.GetName]. Evidently, they do not respect the Dragon Throne.
I will remember this!
Assassinate [From.escaped_chinese_noble.GetName]!
[From.escaped_chinese_noble.GetName], an escaped convict, has apparently showed up in [From.GetTitledName]'s court, and [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to hand them over.
Dispatch some soldiers to arrest them!

You have learned that [From.escaped_chinese_noble.GetName] somehow managed to escape from [From.GetTitledName]'s court before your soldiers arrived. Clearly, [From.GetTitledName] cannot be trusted not to waste your time.
[From.GetTitledName] disappoints me!
A Diplomatic Mission?

It is only proper that foreign barbarians treat the envoys of the [Root.GetChinaShortName] Empire respectfully. Do you want to send an envoy to [chinese_envoy_target.GetTitledName] to see if they respect the Dragon Throne?
Let's send an envoy!
This can wait!
An Envoy Refused

It would seem [From.GetTitledName] does not respect the Middle Kingdom. [From.GetSheHeCap] went so far as to refuse to see your envoy, which is a major sign of disrespect towards the Dragon Throne itself.
How barbaric!
Proper Respect

While [From.GetSheHe] still is a foreign barbarian, [From.GetTitledName] has shown your envoys great respect during their visit to [From.GetHerHis] court, and by extension [From.GetSheHe] clearly respects the Dragon Throne.
Civilized barbarians?
No Respect

While [From.GetTitledName] welcomed your envoys, [From.GetSheHe] still is a foreign barbarian, and [From.GetHerHis] respect towards your envoys was lacking. By extension, [From.GetTitledName] disrespects the Dragon Throne itself
How barbaric!
A Trade Competition?

That barbarians from faraway lands want to trade with the Middle Kingdom is well known. However, though most of them deserve no special treatment, occassionally one of them are worthy of better treatment. Should we let some of them compete for this right?
Let's hold a trade competition!
This seems unnecessary...
A New City

[From.GetTitledName] has had a new city constructed along the Silk Road to prove that they are worthy of more favorable trade deals with the Middle Kingdom. It is undeniable that they have done well, and we should reward them accordingly.
Let them know that I am pleased!
Disappointment

Despite the honor of being allowed to prove themselves worthy of being granted favorable trade deals with the Middle Kingdom, none of the barbarians given this honor have lived up to expectations, and it is clear they should not be granted any rewards.
Let them know I am displeased!
Gold is certainly nice!

[From.escaped_chinese_noble.GetName], an escaped convict, has apparently showed up in [From.GetTitledName]'s court, and [From.GetTitledName] has not seen fit to inform you of this, unlike what might be expected.
Demand that they had the convict over!
Let it slide
Broke Chinese Peace Deal
Betrayed me to China
Agreed to request
Informed me of escapee
Let convict escape
Refused request
The [From.GetTitle] of the [Root.GetChinaShortName] addresses a letter to the [Root.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [Root.GetTitle] of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]

column2: [Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a History of [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName].
A [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Compendium of Medicine!
A [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Treatise on Law
A [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Chronicle of Economic Principle

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Compendium of Medicine.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Treatise on Law.

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Chronicle of Economic Principle.
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a Jade Dragon.
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a copy of the Art of War.
[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has seen fit to grant you a copy of The Classic of Poetry.
Which artifact do you wish to send to [FromFromFromFrom.GetTitledName]?
A Jade Dragon
A copy of the Art of War
A copy of The Classic of Poetry
An Imperial Marriage?

Your ministers inform you that your vassal [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for an Imperial Marriage between [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] and a Chinese princess of your choice in exchange for 1000 gold\n\nRefusing the request without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
[dragon_bride_1.GetBestName] shall marry [FromFromFrom.GetBestName]!
[dragon_bride_2.GetBestName] will be sent!
[dragon_bride_3.GetBestName] is the perfect bride!
Unfortunately, I have no princess to send...
[FromFromFrom.GetBestName] does not deserve an Imperial Marriage!
The Dragon Throne refuses, because I said so!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to an Imperial Marriage between [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName] and [dragon_bride.GetFullName].
May the union be fruitful!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] is unfortunately unable to send an Imperial Princess to marry [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName] at this time.
I suppose we could try again later...

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] will not send an Imperial Princess to marry the likes of [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName], as he is unworthy of such an honor.
I will not forget this!
An Imperial Marriage?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy asking for an Imperial Marriage between [FromFromFrom.GetBestName] and [From.GetBestName] in exchange for 1000 gold.\n\nRefusing the requestwithout a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
Of course we will agree to this!
I have other plans for her...
[FromFromFrom.GetBestName] does not deserve an Imperial Marriage!
The Dragon Throne refuses, because I said so!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to an Imperial Marriage between [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName] and [dragon_bride.GetFullName].
May the union be fruitful!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] is unfortunately unable to agree to the marriage you asked for on behalf of [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName] at this time.
I suppose we could try again later...

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] will not send an Imperial Princess to marry the likes of [FromFromFromFrom.GetBestName], as he is unworthy of such an honor.
I will not forget this!
Tianxia
§BJade Dragon:§! Imperial Marriages
Enabled
Disabled
Female relatives of a Chinese Imperial Emperor of China cannot be married normally. The "Request Imperial Marriage" interactions are enabled.
Female relatives of a Chinese Imperial Emperor of China can be married normally. The "Request Imperial Marriage" interactions are disnabled.
It is no longer possible for you to complete your quest to kowtow before the Dragon Throne.
Respected my envoy
Disrespected my envoy

Desired by many for its intrinsic value and the beautiful design which displays the height of the [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Empire, this intricately designed dragon made out of jade by a master [From.OriginalOwner.Culture.GetName] craftsman is a very unique treasure.
column3: Nombreux sont ceux qui le veulent pour sa valeur intrinsèque et son esthétique affichant la grandeur de [offmap_china.GetFullGenericName], ce dragon finement sculpté fait en jade par un maître-artisan [From.OriginalOwner.GetCultureMasc] est un trésor unique.
column4: Von vielen für seinen inneren Wert und das schöne Design geschätzt, wurde dieser kompliziert entworfene Drache aus Jade von einem meisterhaften [From.OriginalOwner.Culture.GetName]en Handwerker geschaffen und ist ein sehr einzigartiger Schatz.
column6: Deseado por muchos por su valor intrínseco y el hermoso diseño que muestra la altura del [offmap_china.GetFullGenericName], este dragón intricadamente diseñado de jade por un maestro artesano [From.OriginalOwner.Culture.GetName] es un tesoro único.

column2: Create China
While it is obvious to us that we hold the Mandate of Heaven, we have to take certain steps to ensure that the world is of the same opinion.
Declare new capital
As the ruler of the Middle Kingdom, we can decide to move its administrative centre to another suitable location.
Increase Tributary Tier War
$ORDER$$FIRST_ADJ$-$SECOND_ADJ$ Integration War
Increased tributary tier
Decreased tributary tier
Refused higher tributary tier request
Refused lower tributary tier request
Refused higher tributary tier request
Requested border adjustment
Refused border adjustment
Refused border adjustment
A Closer Relationship?

Your ministers inform you that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has sent an envoy to offer to grant the Dragon Throne greater control over [FromFrom.GetHerHis] realm, should you wish to accept it.\n\nAccepting the offer would increase the amount of control we exercise over [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s realm, but also make them expect more from us. Refusing without a good reason would be a widely unpopular move.
Assume direct control!
Their terms are acceptable
Ignore the envoy, for a good reason
Ignore the envoy, for no reason

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] accepts your offer to tie your realm more closely to the Dragon Throne.
Excellent!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitledName] refuses your outrageous request to become more closely associated with the Dragon Throne.
Really? I excepted more...
A Looser Relationship?

A Closer Relationship?

Your overlord, [FromFrom.GetTitledName], ruler of [Root.GetChinaShortName], has sent envoys bringing extravagant gifts and a request to re-define the relationship between your realms to be a bit more close.

From highest to lowest, the tiers are
-(Vassal)
-Client State
-Protectorate
-Imperial Tributary
-Peripheral Tributary
I find those terms acceptable!
Spend Grace to avoid having to accept
Never! Do your worst!

To the esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

I find your terms acceptable, and look forward to having a closer relationship between your realm and mine.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetTitledNameWithNick]
Assuming direct control!
I'm sure this will be mutually beneficial!

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetTitledNameWithNick]

By my hand and seal,

A Looser Relationship?

Word has reached you that [Root.GetChinaShortName] recently lost a war against one of its tributaries due to a supposed misunderstanding as to how close the relationship should be. The Dragon Throne has sent an envoy suggesting that you should take the opportunity to make sure that your agreement is satisfactory.\n\nIt is doubtful that it would be appreciated if we opted for a looser association with [Root.GetChinaShortName], but it might be a waste to let this opportunity slip by if we want more freedom.
It is satisfactory already
A looser agreement would be better

To the esteemed [Root.GetTitledName],

Due to recent events, it is clear that our previous relationship was unsatisfactory, and we thus need to make the terms a bit looser. Surely you agree.

By my hand and seal,
[From.GetTitledNameWithNick]
I suppose it is for the best...
